customer_journey.awareness: Discovery through Michelin guides, Zagat ratings, social media influencer posts, word-of-mouth from trusted sources, or corporate concierge recommendations - typically 3-4 weeks before special occasion
customer_journey.consideration: Reviews on OpenTable, Resy, Google with 4.5+ stars, Instagram visual validation, menu preview online, price point assessment against occasion importance, availability checking for preferred dates
customer_journey.decision: Reservation made 2-3 weeks in advance for weekends, dietary accommodation confirmation, special request arrangements, deposit or cancellation policy acceptance, calendar blocking
customer_journey.retention: Post-dining survey within 48 hours, personalized thank you from management, birthday/anniversary database entry, exclusive event invitations, preferred reservation status after 3 visits
customer_journey.advocacy: Social media posts during/after meal (67% share photos), detailed reviews on multiple platforms, direct referrals to social circle, corporate account recommendations, return visits with new guests

urgency_drivers: Limited seating with 30-day advance booking for weekends during peak season

Holiday prix fixe menus requiring deposits 2-3 weeks in advance

objection_handlers.response: Position as investment in extraordinary experiences, highlight value through included courses, service, ambiance worth 3x fast casual
Frame as part of special occasion experience, offer specific guidance, emphasize enhancing overall ambiance for all guests

objection_handlers.objection: Portions too small for the price
objection_handlers.response: Educate on multi-course progression, quality of ingredients (organic, imported, rare), culinary technique value, typical 7-9 courses totaling substantial meal
Reframe as entertainment experience not just meal, highlight pacing designed for conversation and enjoyment, option for abbreviated menu
Emphasize warm hospitality training, knowledgeable staff as guides not gatekeepers, accommodation of all comfort levels
Highlight chef's creativity with restrictions, advance notice enables custom menu creation, 48-hour notice ensures exceptional alternatives
Offer valet service details, nearby garage partnerships with validation, rideshare drop-off zone, emphasize destination-worthy experience

guarantees: Satisfaction guarantee with meal replacement if not delighted
Timely seating guarantee within 15 minutes of reservation
proof_points: Executive chef with Michelin star experience
risk_reversal.risk_mitigation: Reservation deposits fully refundable with 48-hour notice, wine selection assistance from certified sommelier, detailed menu descriptions preventing surprises, ability to modify prix fixe based on preferences

product_launch.description: 4-week campaign for launching seasonal menu or exclusive dining experience
industry_themes: Week 1: Ingredient provenance and seasonal anticipation - teasing rare ingredients and farm partnerships
Week 2: Behind-the-scenes culinary mastery - revealing chef's creative process and plating artistry
Week 3: Guest experience transformations - showcasing unforgettable moments and emotional reactions
Week 4: Scarcity and exclusive reservation access - creating urgency for limited availability
weekly_hooks: This morning's harvest: [Seasonal ingredient] from [Local farm/region], arriving at peak perfection for our [Season] menu debut
Our chef has been working with [Rare ingredient] for 6 months. Watch the first reveal of what's coming [Date]
Only [Number] diners will experience our [Season] tasting menu each evening - reservations open [Date]
Watch our acclaimed chef transform a single [Ingredient] into 7 different textures and temperatures
Behind the pass: The intricate 12-step process that makes our [Signature dish] unforgettable
From farm to plate in 6 hours - follow [Ingredient]'s journey from [Source] to your table tonight
Where [City] celebrates life's most important moments - see how we made their anniversary unforgettable
Our clients were blown away: How [Dish/Experience] turned a business dinner into a memorable partnership
This is what happens when you trust our chef with your milestone celebration - [Guest testimonial preview]
Final call: Only [Number] tables remain for our [Menu name] experience - Reservations close [Date]
Michelin-starred [Season] menu now open for booking - [Number] courses of exceptional artistry
Last chance to secure your table for [Special experience] before we're fully booked through [Month]
objection_sequence: Week 1: Address intimidation factor - emphasize warm hospitality and knowledgeable staff as guides
Week 2: Address concerns about understanding the experience - educate on multi-course progression and what to expect
Week 3: Address portion size concerns - showcase 7-9 course progression totaling substantial, satisfying meal
Week 4: Address price value - highlight rare ingredients, culinary technique, and investment in extraordinary memories
proof_timing: Week 1: Introduce farm partnerships and ingredient sourcing credentials to build quality trust
Week 2: Share chef's background, awards (Michelin stars, James Beard) and culinary training
Week 3: Feature authentic guest testimonials about special occasions and exceeded expectations
Week 4: Final push with reservation scarcity proof (sold out dates, waitlist numbers, press mentions)
cta_progression: Week 1: Learn more about our seasonal ingredient philosophy [Link to blog/story]
Week 2: Watch the full behind-the-scenes video series on our Stories
Week 3: Share your most memorable dining moment with us in the comments
Week 4: Reserve your table now - limited availability for [Month] bookings [Reservation link]
platform_priority: Instagram (5-7 posts/week, 1-2 Reels, daily Stories) - primary platform for visual storytelling and engagement
Email (2 emails over 4 weeks) - exclusive early access announcements to VIP list
Google Business Profile (2-3 posts/week) - capture high-intent local searchers
Facebook (3 posts/week) - event announcements and reaching corporate planners
product_launch.research_basis: Based on Eleven Madison Park's seasonal menu announcement campaigns (20-30% email open rates) and Alinea's behind-the-scenes content (50K-150K views, 3-5% engagement). Combines provenance storytelling with scarcity messaging proven by The French Laundry's reservation releases (40%+ open rates, fills within minutes).

Hi [FIRST_NAME],

Your reservation is [NUMBER] days away. We're already preparing to make it exceptional.

But first—a few insider tips that transform good dinners into unforgettable ones:

**PROBLEM: Most guests don't know how to get the most from their fine dining experience.**

We see it constantly: Diners who feel intimidated by the wine list. Couples who rush through courses. Guests who don't mention dietary preferences until they're seated.

You're investing in this experience. Here's how to maximize it:

**1. COMMUNICATE WITH US**

→ Dietary needs? We need [TIMEFRAME] notice to prepare properly  
→ Nervous about wine? That's literally what our sommelier loves most

**2. TRUST THE TASTING MENU**
→ It's Chef [NAME]'s vision, fully realized
→ You'll try [NUMBER] dishes you'd never order solo
→ Pacing is built in—no decision fatigue

**3. ARRIVE [NUMBER] MINUTES EARLY**
→ Settle in, have a cocktail, absorb the ambiance
→ Rushed arrivals = rushed experiences
→ We hold your table for [NUMBER] minutes

**4. ASK QUESTIONS**
→ How was this prepared?
→ Where did this ingredient come from?  
→ What's the story behind this dish?
→ Our team loves sharing—that's part of the experience

tiktok.hook: POV: You're wondering if fine dining is actually worth $300
tiktok.body: Shot 1 (0-3s): Close-up of bill with price circled. Shot 2 (4-15s): Time-lapse of chef hand-making pasta from scratch, 47 steps shown in fast motion. Shot 3 (16-30s): Split screen showing grocery store tomato vs. heirloom tomato from local farm with farmer cameo. Shot 4 (31-45s): Reveal full 9-course progression with voiceover: 'You're not paying for food. You're paying for 6 hours of prep, 15 years of training, and ingredients you can't buy.' Shot 5 (46-60s): Final plating shot with text overlay showing breakdown: $80 ingredients, $120 labor/expertise, $100 experience/ambiance.
tiktok.cta: Book your once-in-a-lifetime experience. Link in bio.

reels.hook: First time at a Michelin restaurant? Here's what they won't tell you.
reels.body: Shot 1 (0-2s): Nervous diner looking at menu. Shot 2 (3-10s): Quick cuts with text overlays: 'Ask questions - chefs LOVE talking food' 'No wrong wine choice - that's what sommeliers are for' 'Dress code? Business casual is fine'. Shot 3 (11-20s): Show relaxed, smiling diners being guided by staff. Shot 4 (21-28s): Beautiful dish reveal with text: 'You belong here.' Shot 5 (29-30s): Logo and reservation link.

ugc_prompts.prompt: Share a photo of your most memorable dish from your visit and tell us which course surprised you most. Tag us for a chance to win a complimentary wine pairing on your next reservation.

Record a 15-second reaction video of your favorite moment from your evening - could be a dish reveal, an amuse-bouche surprise, or the ambiance. Best reactions featured in our monthly guest spotlight.

viral_triggers.angle: Price breakdown transparency series - show exactly where your $250 per person goes: $65 ingredients with farmer stories, $95 labor showing 18-hour prep days, $45 ambiance/rent, $45 service training. Film in documentary style with real numbers on screen.
viral_triggers.why: Addresses biggest objection (price anxiety), educational, builds trust, shareable to justify spending to partners, fills competitive gap around transparent value communication

viral_triggers.angle: Staff transformation stories - '5 years ago I was washing dishes, today I'm your sous chef' series featuring real team members' journey from entry-level to expertise, showing the human investment behind each plate.
viral_triggers.why: Humanizes the experience, creates emotional connection, differentiates from competitors, taps into underdog narrative, highly shareable feel-good content, addresses 'pretentious' objection
